Lang.Name: GEN013
Lang.Text: THE AIP STRUCTURE AND ESTABLISHED REGULAR AMENDMENT INTERVAL

Lang.Name: GEN014
Lang.Text: SERVICE TO CONTACT IN CASE OF DETECTED AIP ERRORS OR OMISSIONS

Lang.Name: AD28
Lang.Text: Aprons, Taxiways And Check Locations/positions Data

Lang.Name: AD29
Lang.Text: Surface Movement Guidance And Control System And Markings

Lang.Name: AD38
Lang.Text: Aprons, Taxiways And Check Locations/Positions Data

Lang.Name: CodeAirspace_NO_FIR
Lang.Text: Airspace for which not even an FIR is defined

Lang.Name: CodeAirspace_PROTECT
Lang.Text: Airspace protected from specific air traffic

Lang.Name: CodeAirspace_ATZ_P
Lang.Text: Part of an airport traffic zone

Lang.Name: CodeAirspace_NAS_P
Lang.Text: A part of a national airspace system

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_AD_TFC
Lang.Text: All traffic on the manoeuvring area of an aerodrome and all aircraft flying in the vicinity of an aerodrome

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_TRAINING
Lang.Text: Flights conducted for the purpose of training

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_AEROBATICS
Lang.Text: The usage of unusual or artful flying manoeuvres for recreation, competition, or entertainment

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_AIRSHOW
Lang.Text: A show at which aircraft are on view and featuring aerial displays

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_SPORT
Lang.Text: The competition or practice by an individual or a group to achieve the best aerial performance

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_PARAGLIDER
Lang.Text: Recreational and competitive flying sport using a free-flying, foot launched aircraft

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_HANGGLIDING
Lang.Text: Recreational and competitive flying sport using a small glider from which the operator is suspended in a frame and which is controlled by movements of the body

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_PARACHUTE
Lang.Text: Exiting a flying aircraft by an individual using a parachute

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_AIR_DROP
Lang.Text: The dropping of troops, supplies, bombs, etc., from an aircraft

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_BALLOON
Lang.Text: Flight activity involving a bag called the envelope that is capable of containing heated air, with a gondola or basket suspended beneath

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_RADIOSONDE
Lang.Text: The lifting of devices through the atmosphere, which are tied to a helium or hydrogen filled balloon

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_SPACE_FLIGHT
Lang.Text: Vertical launch for space flight operations

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_UAV
Lang.Text: The operation of a powered, aerial vehicle that does not carry a human operator

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_AERIAL_WORK
Lang.Text: Operations in which an aircraft is used for specialized services

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_CROP_DUSTING
Lang.Text: Spraying crops with fertilizers, pesticides, and fungicides from an agricultural aircraft

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_FIRE_FIGHTING
Lang.Text: Intense fire fighting activity involving chemical agents being laid down from fire fighting aircraft

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_MILOPS
Lang.Text: The execution of operations by the military

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_REFUEL
Lang.Text: Transfer of fuel between aircraft in the air

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_JET_CLIMBING
Lang.Text: Climb-out of jet aircraft via predefined and common tracks

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_EXERCISE
Lang.Text: Intercepting and destroying of hostile aircraft or conducting similar training activities

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_TOWING
Lang.Text: Drawing or pulling through the air a target for aerial shooting practice

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_NAVAL_EXER
Lang.Text: Naval forces (for example: vessels or aircraft) conduct firing and/or munitions exercise

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_MISSILES
Lang.Text: The launch, transit, and targeting of guided missiles

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_AIR_GUN
Lang.Text: The delivery of air to air or air to ground weapons for the destruction of a target

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_ARTILLERY
Lang.Text: The discharge of a projectile into the air for the destruction of a target

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_SHOOTING
Lang.Text: The discharge of a gun or bow to propel arrows, bullets, etc swiftly or violently direct and sharply in specified directions

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_BLASTING
Lang.Text: Controlled use of explosives to excavate or remove rock

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_WATER_BLASTING
Lang.Text: The action or an act of forcing out or emitting something suddenly underwater

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_ANTI_HAIL
Lang.Text: The use of small rockets to protect crops by seeding clouds with small particles that prevent hailstorms from forming

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_BIRD_MIGRATION
Lang.Text: A high number of bird species as they fly instinctual routes based on breeding or diverse environmental urges

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_HI_RADIO
Lang.Text: Electromagnetic fields produced by high intensity radio transmission

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_HI_LIGHT
Lang.Text: Non-navigational lights with high visibility potential

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_LASER
Lang.Text: The emission of photons in a coherent beam by an optical source

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_NATURE
Lang.Text: Wildlife, flora, fauna or features of geological or other special interest which is reserved and managed for conservation

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_FAUNA
Lang.Text: The animals or animal life of a given area, habitat, or epoch which is easily and dangerously aroused by excessive aerial noise such as from an aircraft

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_NO_NOISE
Lang.Text: Airspace in which special procedures or other precautionary measures are established for reducing noise

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_ACCIDENT
Lang.Text: Airspace needing a protective status due to an investigation of a flight catastrophe

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_POPULATION
Lang.Text: An area with a high concentration of inhabitants

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_VIP
Lang.Text: The presence of an individual of renowned status and considered as a very important person

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_VIP_PRES
Lang.Text: The presence of an individual with status of head of state

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_VIP_VICE
Lang.Text: The presence of an individual with status of Vice-Head of State

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_OIL
Lang.Text: An area in which oil occurs in quantities worthy of exploitation

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_GAS
Lang.Text: Pumping natural gas from the ground or converting gasoline into vapour

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_REFINERY
Lang.Text: A facility where petroleum and/or petroleum products are refined

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_CHEMICAL
Lang.Text: A facility utilizing a chemical process for manufacturing

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_NUCLEAR
Lang.Text: An installation which provides power, derived from fission or fusion of atomic nuclei

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_TECHNICAL
Lang.Text: Generic technical activity affecting air traffic

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_ATS
Lang.Text: Custom specific flight information service, alerting service, air traffic advisory service, air traffic control service, area control service, approach control service, or airport control service is provided

Lang.Name: CodeAirspaceActivity_PROCEDURE
Lang.Text: Special procedures established for use by operational personnel in execution of their flight

Lang.Name: ENR531
Lang.Text: OTHER ACTIVITIES OF A DANGEROUS NATURE

Lang.Name: GEN334
Lang.Text: COORDINATION BETWEEN THE OPERATOR AND ATS
